1.sentence_1: To be safest, just assume that everything you bring is going to get wet.
1.sentence_2: To be safest <as you pack>, just assume that everything you bring is going to get wet.
1.context_before: At the very least, aim to drink 16oz or more of water in the hour leading up to your swim. Stuff phones, electronics, and valuables in resealable plastic bags.
1.context_after: If you are taking things like your mobile phone that can't get wet, take them in a separate small bag, pockets of your clothes or a waterproof bag which you can put in your swimming bag.

2.sentence_1: Go for a common bike - they also have the advantage of a lower resale value.
2.sentence_2: Go for a common bike - they also have the advantage of a lower resale value, <so you 'll get a better bargain>.
2.context_before: When buying used, stay away from lesser-known models. Although the seller may try to sell it as a "collector's bike" or a "rare find" don't go for it. Rare and limited-run bikes are difficult to find parts for when they break down.
2.context_after: Common models are also more likely to have online guides or forums where you can find help with maintenance.

3.sentence_1: Aligning fractured bones is best left to trained professionals and should only be attempted by untrained people in extreme and rare emergencies.
3.sentence_2: Aligning fractured bones is best left to trained professionals and should only be attempted <on smaller peripheral bones> by untrained people in extreme and rare emergencies.
3.context_before: If you suspect a bone is broken, try to keep the injured area immobilized and seek medical attention immediately.
3.context_after: Improper handling can lead to permanent damage, so it's crucial not to take unnecessary risks.
